content.description: A student mixes <math alttext="50 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="1.0 molar H C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="50 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="1.0 molar N a O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in a coffee-cup calorimeter and observes the change in temperature until the mixture reaches thermal equilibrium. The initial and final temperatures <math alttext="in degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mi>°</mi><mtext>C)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the mixture are shown in the diagram above of the laboratory setup.
content.question: Based on the results, what is the change in temperature reported with the correct number of significant figures?

skill.text: 2.D: Make observations or collect data from representations of laboratory setups or results, while attending to precision where appropriate.
